titleStmt.title: A reply to the frivolous and impertinent ansvver of R.B. to the discourse of P.B. In which discourse is shewed, that the baptisme in the defection of Antichrist, is the ordinance of God, notwithstanding the corruptions that attend the same, and that the baptisme of infants is lawfull, both which are vindicated from the exceptions of R.B. and further cleared by the same authour. There is also a reply, in way of answer to some exceptions of E.B. against the same.
titleStmt.author: Barbon, Praisegod, 1596?-1679.

notesStmt.note: A reply to Barrow, Robert, A briefe answer to a discourse, and also to Edward Barber's A small treatise of baptisme, or, dipping.
Barrow's A briefe answer was in reply to Barebon's A discourse tending to prove the baptisme in or under the defection of Antichrist to be the ordinance of Jesus.
Epistle to the reader signed: R.B., by error for P.B. P.B. = Praisegod Barbon. -- Cf. BLC.
